description: From Middle French contravenir (French contrevenir), from Latin contraveni≈ç.

verbs.description: contravene (third-person singular simple present contravenes, present participle contravening, simple past and past participle contravened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To act contrary to an order; to fail to conform to a regulation or obligation.
(transitive, obsolete) To deny the truth of something.
